Package io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.util.io.cache

Class CachedResourceManager

java.lang.Object
io.github.thecsdev.tcdcommons.api.util.io.cache.CachedResourceManager
public final class CachedResourceManager extends Object
Caching API for asynchronous fetching and caching of external resources.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static final void init()

    • getResourceAsync

      public static final <R> void getResourceAsync(net.minecraft.util.Identifier resourceId, IResourceFetchTask<R> task) throws NullPointerException
      Asynchronously retrieves or fetches a given external resource and loads it.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the resource being obtained.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The unique Identifier of the resource being obtained.
      task - The IResourceFetchTask that will be used to obtain and handle the resource.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null, or a method in IResourceFetchTask returns null.

    • getResourceSync

      public static final <R> void getResourceSync(net.minecraft.util.Identifier resourceId, IResourceFetchTask<R> task) throws NullPointerException
      Same as getResourceAsync(Identifier, IResourceFetchTask), except all tasks are performed on the current Thread, including the fetching and caching and handling of the CachedResource.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the resource being obtained.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The unique Identifier of the resource being obtained.
      task - The IResourceFetchTask that will be used to obtain and handle the resource.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null, or a method in IResourceFetchTask returns null.

    • forceCache

      public static final void forceCache(net.minecraft.util.Identifier resourceId, CachedResource<?> cachedResource) throws NullPointerException
      Forcefully caches a CachedResource. Although not recommended, use this to manually cache CachedResources on your own.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The unique Identifier of the resource being cached.
      cachedResource - The CachedResource being added to the RESOURCE_CACHE.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null.

    • forceCache

      public static final void forceCache(net.minecraft.util.Identifier resourceId, CachedResource<?> cachedResource, boolean overrideExisting) throws NullPointerException
      Forcefully caches a CachedResource. Although not recommended, use this to manually cache CachedResources on your own.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The unique Identifier of the resource being cached.
      cachedResource - The CachedResource being added to the RESOURCE_CACHE.
      overrideExisting - When true, any existing CachedResources with the same Identifier will be ignored and overridden.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null.

    • forceInvalidate

      public static final void forceInvalidate(net.minecraft.util.Identifier resourceId, boolean deleteCacheFiles) throws NullPointerException
      Forcefully invalidates a CachedResource. Although not recommended, use this to manually invalidate CachedResource entries on your own.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The unique Identifier of the resource being invalidated.
      deleteCacheFiles - If true, an attempt will be made to delete any cache files associated with the CachedResource. Not guaranteed to work!
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null.

    • cachedResourceExists

      public static final boolean cachedResourceExists(net.minecraft.util.Identifier resourceId) throws NullPointerException
      Returns true if a CachedResource exists for a given resource Identifier, either on the RAM or on the user's drive.
      Parameters:
      resourceId - The CachedResource's unique Identifier.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null.

    • getResourceSerializer

      @Nullable public static final <T> @Nullable CachedResourceSerializer<T> getResourceSerializer(Class<T> resourceType) throws NullPointerException
      Obtains the CachedResourceSerializer for a given CachedResource type.
      Parameters:
      resourceType - A Class instance representing the type of resource.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If an argument is null.
      See Also:
      • TRegistries.CACHED_RESOURCE_SERIALIZER
